title: Netflix to Buy Special-Effects Firm Behind 'Stranger Things,' 'Game of Thrones'; Deal for Canada-based Scanline is latest in a string of acquisitions by streaming company
text:
Terms of the deal weren't released. Netflix said it expects the sale to close in the first quarter of 2022.

Other Netflix shows Scanline has worked on include the new program "Cowboy Bebop" and coming movies "The Gray Man," starring Ryan Gosling, and "Don't Look Up," starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Jennifer Lawrence.

Besides its work on Netflix shows, Scanline has also been involved in HBO's "Game of Thrones" as well as theatrical movies including "Justice League" and "Godzilla vs. King Kong."

Ms. Reinhard said Scanline would continue to operate as a standalone business after the deal closes, and work with a variety of clients. Netflix will also work with other special-effects firms "so we can continue to ensure that our creators have access to the world's most innovative tech, and continue to bring the most compelling and cutting-edge storytelling to our members," she said.

The deal is the latest in a string of acquisitions by Netflix at the same time it is facing increased competition from Walt Disney Co.'s Disney+, AT&T Inc.'s HBO Max and other streaming services. Subscription growth has also slowed for Netflix in some key markets, including North America.
